function.name: about_info_free_for_bulk_whatsapp_validator
function.description:
This is the subfunction for tool "bulk_whatsapp_validator", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "You need a **valid token** to use this endpoint, learn how to get it on this [video](https://youtu.be/TcaAwKpAkl8). 
This endpoint will return the `About` info of the number, and the time when the value was set."

phone.description:
The phone number must be written as a number (including countrycode); 
do **NOT** include: any non-number character, spaces, or anything which is not a number; do **NOT** add zeros (0) at the beginning.

token.description: To get a free token, click [here](https://wa.me/34631428039?text=get-token) to send a whatsapp with the command `get-token`.

function.name: is_a_business_free_for_bulk_whatsapp_validator
function.description:
This is the subfunction for tool "bulk_whatsapp_validator", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "You need a **valid token** to use this endpoint, learn how to get it on this [video](https://youtu.be/TcaAwKpAkl8). 
Requests to this endpoint will return `true` if the number is a **Whatsapp for Business** account, or `false` if it's not."

phone.description:
The phone number must be written as a number (including countrycode); 
do **NOT** include: any non-number character, spaces, or anything which is not a number; do **NOT** add zeros (0) at the beginning.

token.description: To get a free token, click [here](https://wa.me/34631428039?text=get-token) to send a whatsapp with the command `get-token`.

function.name: validate_wa_number_free_for_bulk_whatsapp_validator
function.description:
This is the subfunction for tool "bulk_whatsapp_validator", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "You need a **valid token** to use this endpoint, learn how to get it on this [video](https://youtu.be/TcaAwKpAkl8). 
The response is `true` if the phone is registered on whatsapp."

phone.description:
The phone number must be written as a number (including countrycode); 
do **NOT** include: any non-number character, spaces, or anything which is not a number; do **NOT** add zeros (0) at the beginning.

token.description: To get a free token, click [here](https://wa.me/34631428039?text=get-token) to send a whatsapp with the command `get-token`.

function.name: is_a_business_for_bulk_whatsapp_validator
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "bulk_whatsapp_validator", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Requests to this endpoint will return `true` if the number is a **Whatsapp for Business** account, or `false` if it's not."

phone.description:
The whatsapp number must be written as: `countrycode` and `number`; do NOT include any non-number character, spaces, or anything which is not a number.
Examples: of correct numbers are: `34123456789` (for spain) or `491234567890` (for Germany).

function.name: about_info_for_bulk_whatsapp_validator
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "bulk_whatsapp_validator", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "This endpoint will return the *About* state of the WA number on the query."

function.name: Finish
function.description: If you believe that you have obtained a result that can answer the task, please call this function to provide the final answer. Alternatively, if you recognize that you are unable to proceed with the task in the current state, call this function to restart. Remember: you must ALWAYS call this function at the end of your attempt, and the only part that will be shown to the user is the final answer, so it should contain sufficient information.

final_answer.description: The final answer you want to give the user. You should have this field if "return_type"=="give_answer"

2.All the thought is short, at most in 5 sentence.
3.You can do more then one trys, so if your plan is to continusly try some conditions, you can do one of the conditions per try.

2.Do not use origin tool names, use only subfunctions' names.

    "function_output": "{\"error\": \"Tool input parse error...\\n\", \"response\": \"\"}",
    "mento-carlo-action-value": 0.0
  }
]

2. If the number is registered, use the "about_info_free_for_bulk_whatsapp_validator" function to get the 'About' info of the number.
3. Check if any of the numbers are business accounts using the "is_a_business_for_bulk_whatsapp_validator" function.

answer_generation.query: I want to check if my company's WhatsApp numbers are valid. The numbers are +1234567890, +9876543210, and +4567891230. Can you verify if they are registered on WhatsApp and provide me with the 'About' info? Additionally, let me know if any of them are business accounts.
